statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

header.gameNote: CHICAGO INVITATIONAL CHALLENGE AT HOFFMAN ESTATES IL

article.headline: Xavier 78, Kent St. 65
article.story: HOFFMAN ESTATES, Ill. (AP) -- Senior forward Josh Duncan scored 20 points and provided a critical second half spark to lead Xavier in a 78-65 victory over Ohio rival Kent State on Friday. The third round win at the Chicago Invitational Challenge was the Musketeers' 10th in 15 meetings with The Golden Flashes dating back to 1946 and fifth straight since 1991. Kent State (3-2) had closed the gap to 46-43 with 11 minutes, 16 seconds left in regulation when Duncan collected 10 straight points over the following two minutes. By the time he was through, Xavier's lead was 56-45. The Golden Flashes never got closer than six points the rest of the way. The Musketeers (3-1) closed with a 12-5 run -- including six points from senior guard Drew Lavender -- in the final four minutes. Lavender finished with 16 points while teammates Derrick Brown and B.J. Raymond added 13 and 10 points, respectively. Brown also had 10 rebounds for his first career double-double. Senior guard Mike Scott paced Kent State with 20 points, including 3-of-7 from three-point range, while junior guard Al Fisher came off the bench to score 16 points. Xavier will play either No. 8 Indiana or Illinois State on Saturday in the Invitational finale.
